text: Eric Garth Hudson (August 2, 1937 â€“ January 21, 2025) was a Canadian musician. He was best known as the keyboardist and saxophonist for the rock group The Band. He was honored into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1994. Hudson was the last living original member of the Band. Hudson also played the piano, accordion, electronic keyboards, and saxophones (alto, tenor, soprano, baritone, bass). He was an inspiration for Elton John. Hudson died in his sleep at a nursing home in Woodstock, New York on January 21, 2025, at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Canadian rock musicians Category:Canadian keyboardists Category:Canadian jazz musicians Category:Saxophonists Category:Musicians from Ontario Category:People from Windsor, Ontario
title: Garth Hudson
